name: NPNP
description: Pretty boring, yet quite successful until now deck. Haven't managed to make Edge of World work yet, therefore I think it's a dead card, but don't know what to put in instead. The initial concept was to lure the runner into an ambush when at match point. Probably remove that and 1 Shipment from SanSan for 2 Beanstalk Royalties. TMI is used as an Account Siphon defense on HQ. Closed Accounts and Freelancer are there to punish a runner if he has some tags floating and Psychographics in case they go in tag-me mode probably for overadvancing Project Beale.

name: Through the Keyhole
description: Easy marks are Lawyer up. Scheherezade is Keyhole. Just an R&D access anarch build. First turn keyhole (scheherezade) is more important than a medium (I may go -1 nerve agent +1 medium but I want to be able to threaten HQ too.) since the keyhole let's you look at more cards initially and overall as well as a built in IMP effect if you don't see an agenda. Trash ICE on R&D, siphon corp to keep them from rezzing in the first place, lawyer up (easy marks), and keep the pressure up. Whizzard to run after their drip economy, JackHo, etc. I think keyhole gives anarch a strong chance at making a comeback now but I think they still lack the ability to handle a long game or big ICE.

name: Through the Keyhole
description: Updated with actual cards thanks to X3r0h0ur. :) Just an R&D access anarch build. First turn keyhole (scheherezade) is more important than a medium (I may go -1 nerve agent +1 medium but I want to be able to threaten HQ too.) since the keyhole let's you look at more cards initially and overall as well as a built in IMP effect if you don't see an agenda. Trash ICE on R&D, siphon corp to keep them from rezzing in the first place, lawyer up (easy marks), and keep the pressure up. Whizzard to run after their drip economy, JackHo, etc. I think keyhole gives anarch a strong chance at making a comeback now but I think they still lack the ability to handle a long game or big ICE.

name: Spam that button!
description: Just a crazy idea to make archives a deadly run. The perfect opening hand would be Celebrity Gift + Panic Button. Play CG and then install PB on your HQ. When the inevitable run to HQ comes, buy a lot of cards and get ready to make archives a really dangerous place. Something like 2 shocks and 2 agendas and some protection is enough. The more 1pt agendas in the archives the better, it will make Punitive Counterstrike end the game faster. Interns to control the archives (dont put any Fetal AI there).

name: Kates e3 shutdown
description: With thanks to x3r0h0ur for telling me how to get true colors in here. :) This is my current Kate build. The idea is to get a MO out then get a garrote on dinosaurus, a torch and a Corroder and run. Keyhole is mostly for jinteki and opening hand draws against undefended servers. Deus X (and clone chips) and net shield for the jinteki matchup as well. e3 because HB and I want to make sure I draw it if I need it. I'm debating dropping the net shield and a deus X for 2 Atman. Atman has worked well for me in general but it's never been a staple icebreaker, more situational and early threat uses. I still think the deus x and net shield are a solid investment even if I don't use them every game. They're going to be so strong against jinteki (and the occasional AP ICE) they're worth the slots. I'm thinking I can go tag me, but psychographics is a thing so I'm debating -1 stimhack, -1 e3, -1?, for +3 Lawyer up for even more card draw and a way to clear tags when I'm trying to run through data ravens but not let them psychographics. Thoughts? Thanks.

name: 1.3.2.4.3 Amazon Counterstrike
description:
So this deck is my first serious attempt to get Amazon Industrial Zone to work for me. In theory, it acts as a conditional Adonis Campaign for as long as I can lay down ice with it. There are a few Oversight AI's in there to help with the more expensive ice if need be.

Of course the plan changes once I have two or three Punitive Counterstrikes in hand (assuming the runner isn't at his match point/has 3 Plascretes installed). At that point, I find a three pointer and just rush advance it. If it gets scored, groovy. If it gets stolen, double "corporations are people too to the face." If I already have a Cleaners scored, most excellent.

If anyone has any ideas on how to make this better, I am all ears.

PS: "Take out Tyrant/Woodcutter" has been pointed out, but those are really just in there to give them a fighting shot until they either work or I throw them across the room and replace them on the spot.

name: NEXT Design: The interns do all the work
description:
This deck is inspired as a mix between the BGG thread on Next Design and db0's RP deck.

Get 2-3 Ice down for the identity, and add an extra ice to the remote. Early game that is hard to break though, where you score an ABT or MU.

Use ABT and Interns to create a glacier that is so expensive that the runner goes broke everytime they run it.

If you can manage to score a MU, try to abuse it with Milenge.

It does seem that this deck gets short on money so I'd be happy to hear suggestions.

BGG Thread: http://boardgamegeek.com/thread/1079213/next-design-analysis-of-its-mechanics-on-a-sampl/page/1

DB0's Untrashable: http://netrunnerdb.com/en/decklist/1268/untrashable-v3

name: It is Pitch Black...
description: Works pretty well but I have trouble with HB's bigger ICE like Janus.

name: Glacial Fortress
description: Big ICE, let's see how it works.
